channel.title: GUI (AutoRune Look-Alike... Attempt)
channel.description:
Well, seeing as I barely knew how to make a GUI, I decided to learn. Learning... is quite a good thing, and all noobs should try it some time. Anyways, I started this project attempting to mimic the basic design of AR and have it parse text scripts. I got kinda bored so I switched to Beanshell interpreting.
I got the JTextAreas and the menus all good. But I was trying to put some JLabels above the JTextAreas and it was a bitch. I had 2 labels... and when I tried to give them a north layout spot, only 1 would show up. So, it kinda seems that you can only have one component set to a certain "spot". I doubt that this is correct, and you guys are prolly smart, so like, any tips would be helpful. Have a look through my source and comment.
Luls, credits to Cheese_Police coz of SCS :D.

Luls, credits to Cheese_Police coz of SCS :D.

How cute, lol

Scripts don’t stop btw, use threadName.interrupt(); and then threadName = null;

item.title: GUI (AutoRune Look-Alike... Attempt)
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Well. Put the two labels onto a JPanel. Then put the JPanel in that ‘spot’.
(Or use GridBagLayout ;))

Read full topic

Well, seeing as I barely knew how to make a GUI, I decided to learn. Learning… is quite a good thing, and all noobs should try it some time. Anyways, I started this project attempting to mimic the basic design of AR and have it parse text scripts. I got kinda bored so I switched to Beanshell interpreting.

I had 2 labels… and when I tried to give them a north layout spot, only 1 would show up. So, it kinda seems that you can only have one component set to a certain “spot”.
